p: A quarter of the articles included South Africa and another country (8/34; 24%; Table 1). Fully 41% of the papers were narrative reviews or editorials (14/34). A further 29% were modelling studies (10/34). Only one article was located that applied qualitative methods. One quarter addressed the effects of heat on health in the country (9/34; 26%), while a third investigated the impact of climate change on infectious diseases (11/34; 32%). Six of these 11 papers addressed malaria. Below, we present a summary of the key findings from the literature reviewed.
